s.text: We're trying to say that solo practice can be among the highest forms of public service, and is the only channel possible to serving low-income people."

As further encouragement for the 200 or so followers they have picked up already, the consortium schools have given their graduates Palm organizers, paid for companies to help with their billing, and offered free legal research and even yoga and meditation classes, almost anything to help make life a little easier for those trying to hang out their shingles.

True or not, there is little debate that most low-income clients, and many in the middle class, find lawyers well outside their financial reach.

Even during more charitable times, the bar association says, most of the free or less costly work is handled by small firms and solo practitioners, making the m a natural target for the consortium's sights.
Life for the partners of Cates, Katalinic & Lund holds little of the glamour one might expect from a career in law.

As further encouragement for the 200 or so followers they have picked up already, the consortium schools have given their graduates Palm organizers, paid for companies to help with their billing, and offered free legal research and even yoga and meditation classes, almost anything to help make life a little easier for those trying to hang out their shingles.
Forget the lure of large firms, the security of a government post.
Forget the lure of large firms, the security of a government post.
I think it's fair to say we'll be heavily discounted.
